intro: Euphrasia collina, commonly known as the hill eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate yellow or greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in spikes. Euphrasia collina is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
